Incredible datapack! I love the rivers too, so nice and loooong, a real boaters paradise. One of the rivers goes through at least 11 biomes and is 8000 blocks long, amazing! And I love how the rivers continue right under a mountain or high ground and draped with glowberries, and then come out the other side. I don't know why mojang didn't do that, it's beautiful.

Summerdrive
Sun Oct 30 12:52:26 GMT 2022

I absolutely love the underground rivers, they are so fantastic, I could almost spend my whole day in a boat! I have a question, is there anything I can tweak in the datapack so that the underground rivers would occur more frequently? There's often 1000s of blocks between sets of them, and I'd like to create them a bit more often. I'm willing to experiment, but I don't know where to start. Thanks.

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 22:11:05 GMT 2022

The underground river placement is determined by mountain range generation. You can force the world to generation more mountainous terrain (and thus more underground rivers), but it would make mountains significantly less steep.

Summerdrive
Sun Oct 30 22:19:33 GMT 2022

I also see several underground rivers under savana and dark forest, does that makes sense too? And of course those beautiful coral rivers under desert hills, which aren't too high.

Summerdrive
Sun Oct 30 23:33:22 GMT 2022

So yes, I would like to experiment with it, even if it made the mountains less steep. Could you tell me what values I should experiment with? Thanks

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:34:27 GMT 2022

alright

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:35:01 GMT 2022

open up the `data` folder, then the `minecraft` folder, then the `worldgen` folder, then the `density_function` folder, then the `overworld` folder

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:35:07 GMT 2022

in there you should see these files:

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:35:12 GMT 2022

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:35:16 GMT 2022

open up `erosion.json`

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:35:40 GMT 2022

you'll see this

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:35:52 GMT 2022

replace 0.2125 with a larger value like 0.3

Apollo
Sun Oct 30 23:36:10 GMT 2022

do not go above 0.5 or so because then terrain might be really screwed up

Summerdrive
Sun Oct 30 23:38:01 GMT 2022

Thanks so much. I'll start experimenting with it

Changing the negative one did change the surface terrain a bit. Do you think I'm not doing something correctly?

Proxilemit

is there a way for sapling to grow into the custom trees?

Apollo
Mon Oct 31 23:43:46 GMT 2022

djs
Tue Nov 1 01:01:29 GMT 2022

It didn't work (well, I guess it did, but I was hoping for dynamic trees), but this forced me to do a deeper dive into dynamic trees to understand how it works. They actually have a default worldgen json file and iteratively replace all trees in vanilla biomes with their trees. Hence, why it doesn't work with modded biomes (and now I understand the need for compatibility mods). Thanks for trying, though!

djs
Thu Nov 3 21:16:03 GMT 2022

as you saw on DT (was gonna post here to you as well), i made it work. you said send via your server, but i don't know what that means. like submit a PR on github?

Apollo
Thu Nov 3 21:16:33 GMT 2022

how exactly did you make it work?

Apollo
Thu Nov 3 21:19:26 GMT 2022

I haven't heard of people making Dynamic Trees work with any datapacks

djs
Thu Nov 3 21:26:34 GMT 2022

i did a mod + datapack; datapack to change the trees to vanilla in all the biomes (just the tree line in the worldgen biome files from "tectonic:xxx" to "minecraft:xxx" (for the 7 biomes you add that have trees, i just chose what seemed to be the most suitable vanilla replacement). then, i did the mod (using the terraforged compat as a guide), and modified worldgen parameters as needed (basically, added tectonic to the first step where they remove all trees in the world, kept the DT vanilla part intact, and for each of the 7 new biomes added what seemed to be an appropriate config). i don't know if the datapack would be able to be combined with the mod or not, but i am happy to leave it in your capable hands (again, not really interested in credit here, just wanted to make a world i was excited to explore).

Apollo
Thu Nov 3 21:30:25 GMT 2022

Interesting, I'm looking into how Terraforged + DT compatibility works right now, and it should be relatively straightforward for me to introduce Tectonic compatibility with DT with an addon mod. Thanks for the information.

djs
Thu Nov 3 21:32:02 GMT 2022

do you want me to send you what i have now?

Apollo
Thu Nov 3 21:33:34 GMT 2022

Yes, that would help a lot.

djs
Thu Nov 3 21:39:17 GMT 2022

DynamicTrees-Tectonic is the mod (i just zipped the folder, the jar is in the build/libs as normal), and tectonic-vt is the datapack that changes the trees to vanilla

Thu Nov 3 21:41:34 GMT 2022

Wed Nov 23 21:40:11 GMT 2022

Wed Nov 23 21:40:16 GMT 2022

Apollo
Wed Nov 23 21:40:55 GMT 2022

GrandmaPork
Wed Nov 23 23:46:42 GMT 2022

Does anyone know if Dynamic Trees works with this mod?

Apollo
Wed Nov 23 23:47:39 GMT 2022

nope

GrandmaPork
Wed Nov 23 23:48:02 GMT 2022

Any plans for DT support?

GrandmaPork
Wed Nov 23 23:48:10 GMT 2022

Or does DT have to do that

Apollo
Wed Nov 23 23:48:30 GMT 2022

DT's system for generating trees is entirely different from the generation system for most other mods and datapacks

Apollo
Wed Nov 23 23:48:59 GMT 2022

it's technically possible but I'd have to have an entirely different version of Tectonic solely for DT support, and maintaining multiple versions can get tricky

Apollo
Wed Nov 23 23:51:16 GMT 2022

someone else made a version of Tectonic with DT compat but it's not going to be supported for future versions https://discord.com/channels/993676606134554624/1027389442513719397/1037843438516850699

GrandmaPork
Wed Nov 23 23:51:58 GMT 2022

Summerdrive
Thu Nov 24 22:20:52 GMT 2022

like Apollo said, and if you want good details on how to use MCASelector to force blending in a world, I've done extensive testing and did some writeups on the MCASelector discord

limesplatus
Thu Nov 24 22:21:18 GMT 2022

I’m just mildly confused why it isn’t automatic in vanilla

Apollo
Thu Nov 24 22:22:03 GMT 2022

it is automatic for jumping between pre-1.18/1.19 versions and post-1.18/1.19 versions

Summerdrive
Thu Nov 24 22:23:24 GMT 2022

like Apollo said, there are conditions for when it works and when not. In the chunks there is a flag that determines it and it was designed mostly for moving from 1.17 and below into 1.18 and once you are 1.18 and above it is disabled - unless you force it

Apollo
Thu Nov 24 22:23:51 GMT 2022

it actually activates when getting to 1.19 so mangrove swamps, deep dark and eroded badlands blend correctly

Summerdrive
Thu Nov 24 22:24:07 GMT 2022

cool, I didn't know that

Apollo
Thu Nov 24 22:25:46 GMT 2022

it's probably not automatic for vanilla to datapack (no version changes) because the game doesn't actually check if it needs to blend and besides, it's not the best idea to add worldgen datapacks to an existing world anyways

naomi
Fri Nov 25 13:50:35 GMT 2022

<@456047744067567617>

Summerdrive
Fri Nov 25 15:58:45 GMT 2022

I'm pretty sure I could prepare an existing world so that a new worldgen datapack could be added that would blend into the world. It would take a few steps, but if someone really wants to add a dp to an existing world then it might be worth it. If anyone is interested I will test it and work out the details.

Trashbag
Fri Nov 25 16:34:14 GMT 2022

Summerdrive
Fri Nov 25 19:01:28 GMT 2022

Ok, I'll give it a try a little later and see what happens, for example I will see how well I can get Tectonic to blend into a pre-existing vanilla world.

Summerdrive
Sat Nov 26 01:02:43 GMT 2022

<@242218787976380417> Here's a short report on attempts to add Tectonic to an existing vanilla world and get it to blend. I used the "Force Blend" function of MCAselector, which works perfectly in other situations, but I found that because of the new Tectonic biomes, that the game's blending algorithms don't recognize them and so the blending only happens over a distance of 1 chunk vs the usual 5-6 chunks. So areas with small height differences blend ok, but big height differences are only slightly smoothed and so stand out. I have some more experiments to do.

Apollo
Sat Nov 26 01:04:02 GMT 2022

oh I think I know why the blending is super sharp

Apollo
Sat Nov 26 01:04:04 GMT 2022

give me a moment

Apollo
Sat Nov 26 01:06:10 GMT 2022

try the blending with this datapack instead

Summerdrive
Sat Nov 26 01:47:23 GMT 2022

<@897998124478521356> Interesting ! This must actually be your oceans dp because that's mostly what it generated. The edges are still smoothed over just one chunk most of the time, but I found one spot where it did a good job, you can see it here in the screenshot. The slightly smoothed badlands wall is the long straight chunk border and in the distance is the better blended area.

Summerdrive
Sat Nov 26 01:48:15 GMT 2022

AND in another area there was nice coral at -14 where it blended with an existing warm ocean !! Yeh !

<@897998124478521356> I did some more blending tests with your new Deeper_Oceans datapack, and I had to be a bit tricky how I did it, but I had a big success! I'm almost sure it worked because this dp does not add any new biomes. You can see in the screenshot that on the left in the distance is a "bad blend" that I left for a comparison, which has a hard chunk border, and on the right is the successful blend. In the distance up high you can see the original warm ocean with coral at it's usual Y level close to the ocean surface, and in the foreground is the lower warm ocean.

GrandmaPork
Sun Dec 4 04:40:24 GMT 2022

Where could I learn how to make my own version of this for 1.18.2? If it’s just replacing tectonics trees with vanilla trees, then replacing those with dynamic trees, shouldn’t it be pretty simple?

djs
Sun Dec 4 11:37:58 GMT 2022

So the mod part would work fine, just need to edit mods.toml and mcmeta to change versions and dependencies. Then there is the easy part and the hard part. The easy part would be a simple copy paste of the changes I made in (Minecraft,tectonic)/worldgen/biomes; may even be able to copy paste the files directly unless Apollo changed them between versions. The hard part is I assume you want this and also the DT plus - I had a look at the files and it is not so straightforward; replacing the cactii is easy, but then there is some strangeness on the DT plus mod compat end (in default.json) with tags that makes me suspect there is some java weirdness going on in the background that i don't understand.

djs
Sun Dec 4 11:40:40 GMT 2022

Also, I have no idea of the recent DT 1.18.2 update changed things in a way that would break my mod (they did say all the mod compats would need to be redone, so...)

djs
Sun Dec 4 20:14:57 GMT 2022

ok so i wound up putting this together, should work (i just ignored trying to make the dt-plus work with tectonic biomes, works automatically for minecraft biomes (e.g. desert)

GrandmaPork
Sun Dec 4 20:51:08 GMT 2022

Oh awesome, I’ll try it out when I can!

djs
Wed Dec 28 06:10:45 GMT 2022

I have finally gotten around to fixing up the dynamic trees / tectonic compat into a single mod, no need for modified version of tectonic or additional datapacks. available at github (https://github.com/djsimmonds/DynamicTreesTectonic) and pending moderation will be available on curse (https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/dynamic-trees-tectonic). works with newest DT (required) and DT+ (optional), as well as tectonic >= 1.1. apollo, please let me know if there are any concerns (i think i am in line with everyone's licenses, etc...), or you would like to be attached to the project on curse and/or github in any capacity.

Amaris
Tue Jan 3 05:29:09 GMT 2023

I've a question- working on a pack with a friend and we have Pam's not generating gardens. We were trying both the mod and the datapack version. We /think/ we've narrowed it down to the worldgen/biome/x.json files in the datapack having "category: none" (he's testing and made it work by changing the datapack to have a correct category in a biome to test). The head in github seems to not have the category at all and the 1-18-2 branch seems to have them correct... though the 1.1.1 mod version for 1.18.2 seems not working- but maybe that's not based on the 1-18-2 branch on github?

djs
Fri Jan 13 22:16:39 GMT 2023

hey apollo, adubbz (BOP developer) has uploaded json versions of mods/features to github for 1.19.3 version. with his permission, i have made this mod which copies BOP json features and replaces 6 tectonic biomes with BOP versions (alpine meadow > fir clearing, autumn forest/autumn birch forest > lavender field.forest, evergreen forest > cherry grove, old growth evergreen > redwood forest, OG snowy taiga > coniferous forest). the changes i made to these tectonic biomes were replacing your vegetation features with BOPs, and adjusting some colors/temps/precipitation values, but left the rest unchanged. for it to work with tectonic, i set the terrablender config weights in BOP config folder to zero (i also turned the the BOP biome flags to false, although not sure if this was necessary if the prior step was done), and it looks the same as if terrablender wasn't used at all. i know you were thinking about doing something like this, so let me know what you think. (clearly, my plan is just to make this compatible with dynamic trees, and i chose the biomes that had the trees i wanted, but can help with other tweaks if you like).

djs
Fri Jan 13 22:21:24 GMT 2023

fyi, here is adubbz post giving permission for using their json features (as you have to use BOP as a dependency for them to do anything anyways)- https://discord.com/channels/138056667865546752/138057116261810176/1063577861572800653

Sat Jan 14 03:24:40 GMT 2023

djs
Sat Jan 14 05:08:09 GMT 2023

don't get too excited; this is a trade-off, as it is a 1-to-1 swapping out of biomes from tectonic (apart from the surface vegetation gen, these are still the same tectonic biomes underneath). this is not a general solution for adding compatibility with other biome mods, or stuffing with extra mods in general. it is a fix that is aimed at those who really would like some BOP trees in their tectonic lives (presumably, for those like me using dynamic trees, as apollo has done quite a nice job on the trees if you are not using DT).

Aziraphale
Sat Jan 14 10:26:29 GMT 2023

It could be potentially adapted for this future perhaps

djs
Sun Jan 15 13:12:02 GMT 2023

https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/dynamic-trees-tectonic-with-bop-features

Aziraphale
Sun Jan 15 13:16:30 GMT 2023

if apollo created enough blank biomes to match the number of biomes in BOP and BYG would that work

djs
Sun Jan 15 13:27:39 GMT 2023

No, I had to hand edit each one and each is just replacing vegetation, not the whole biome. I had to think about which biomes could be appropriate swaps as I prioritized continuity over compatibility. If you tried to generalize this approach, it would never fly (except personal use), as everyone would have different priorities.

Aziraphale
Sun Jan 15 13:40:23 GMT 2023

ah

Atlan
Mon Feb 27 10:49:48 GMT 2023

hope it's not a nag but as it's the last version before 1.20, will the 1.18 release have the option in config to be compatible with BOP? I don't mind if world load takes longer

Apollo
Mon Feb 27 10:51:41 GMT 2023

Probably not, it would take an enormous amount of time that I’d much rather spend on projects I actually want to work on The end result would be a laggy, barely working mess anyways

Vito
Tue Feb 28 12:46:53 GMT 2023

is it gonna be working on 1.19.4 with experimental features?

djs
Tue Feb 28 18:10:19 GMT 2023

Atlan, almost all worldgen packs/mods require a lot of manual work combined with creative decision making and endless iteration/testing to make them good. Each of us has our individual preferences and experiences that define which appeals to us, both aesthetically and in game play. Regarding worldgen, tectonic has been quite satisfying for me (and the rest of us, clearly) on both levels, and has also kept me engaged through Apollo's constant iteration. I personally have never found the kitchen sink terrablender approach with many biomes mods to be satisfying, but I do like some of the biomes and features from other worldgen mods like bop. That's why I made a limited compat between my dynamic trees - tectonic compat mod and bop ("with bop features" as opposed to straight compat), which swapped out a few tectonic biomes for bop ones that I wanted (specifically the surface features) while maintaining harmony with Apollo's work. At it's simplest, you can just go into the giant noise overworked.json file and find/replace to do this (sorry Apollo, snowcapped looks cool and useful but haven't bothered figuring it out yet). This is currently doable with bop as the devs have json versions of their features and biomes on their GitHub, which you will have to include in your pack for the biomes and features you want, then disable all the bop biome generation via terrablender (all weights in config file to zero) so tectonic does all the worldgen and terrablender doesn't mess stuff up. You are welcome to look at my mod (on CF which links to my GitHub) for guidance but overall I recommend thinking about what you want/like as it does not take much coding/modding expertise to do it (I have minimal)

Apollo
Tue Feb 28 19:48:27 GMT 2023

Nope

Vito
Tue Feb 28 19:49:17 GMT 2023

😢

Atlan
Wed Mar 1 10:38:36 GMT 2023

No worries, thanks for the reply :)

Atlan
Wed Mar 1 10:39:22 GMT 2023

Unfortunately time is my bigger constraint :( Thanks for the info and I'll defo look into it if I can ever make the time

JAWredstoneguy
Fri Mar 3 20:38:26 GMT 2023

Apollo
Fri Mar 3 20:39:48 GMT 2023

JAWredstoneguy

Rennen_Rig
Sun Mar 5 20:46:17 GMT 2023

naomi
Sun Mar 5 20:46:44 GMT 2023

**Based** > A word used when you agree with something; or when you want to recognize someone for being themselves, i.e. courageous and unique or not caring what others think. Especially common in online political slang. > > The opposite of cringe, some times the opposite of biased. > > The latter usage is the original use as coined by rapper Lil B, and the word originally took off on the meta-ironic website 4Chan with the latter meaning. For that reason the word is largely used meta-ironically (without context you can't tell if it's being used ironically or sincerely as it's used in both ways) and was popularized in online political slang of conservatives and the political right before being adopted into mainstream online political slang (likely through shitposting websites or subreddits such as r/politicalcompass memes that are similar to 4chan in their meta-irony and "edginess" but contain a wider variety of political beliefs) and eventually adopted into general online vernacular. > > When used in online political language it can mean "based in fact" or the opposite of biased due to the number of people who saw it being first used seriously by the online political right and came to the conclusion that is was related to the phrase "destroyed with facts and logic" in reference to right wing personality Ben Shapiro. > > ***Example 1: meta-ironic** > Shitposter: Posts gif of funny monkey Return to monke > Commentor: Based > > **Example 2: meta-ironic** > 4chan Anon 1: I'm going to commit hate crimes > 4chan Anon 2: Based > > **Example 3: Politics** > Leftist 1: There is no ethical consumption under capitalism. > Leftist 2: Based.*

hhumanoid
Sun Mar 5 20:46:53 GMT 2023

shut the up thats not even the real definition

Rennen_Rig
Sun Mar 5 20:46:57 GMT 2023

When someone says "What's up" I always say "the ceiling duh"

Sun Mar 5 20:47:12 GMT 2023

JAWredstoneguy

<@897998124478521356> Hey! Would it be possible if you could add the tectonic biomes to the "Fabric Biome Convention" tags? They're used by fabric mods to group different biomes into categories for spawning and other purposes. It would allow most biome related mods (such as https://modrinth.com/mod/woof ) to work alongside your datapack Thanks 👍 https://gist.github.com/TelepathicGrunt/b768ce904baa4598b21c3ca42f137f23

hey apollo, sorry to spam with questions. we are working on dt-terralith compat now, and having trouble getting the trees to generate, and i wonder whether differences in the noise router could be contributing. i was able to successfully get dynamic trees to successfully generate on skylands in my dt-tectonic+skylands compat (where i used the terratonic snowcapped you sent, but pulled out all terralith biomes except skylands), and base tectonic noise (terralith was present but on the bottom of the datapack list, just above default). in dt-terralith, we are getting an occasional tree to generate, but the rest of skylands is bare (maybe even more confusing than no trees). regarding the noise router, i see terralith has a noise.json file in density function/skylands (although i can't see any other noise or density function files that call it, so not sure if it's used). could any differences in the noise router cause differences in the timing of feature generation or anything like that? any other thoughts?

djs
Tue Apr 18 14:57:06 +0000 2023

actually, i have figured it out though i'm not sure why; somehow it has to do with adding "forge:use_server_seed": true and a "seed" entry to the dimension/overworld.json

djs
Sat Apr 22 16:42:16 +0000 2023

all this does is pull the data folder out of tectonic and put it in resourcepacks folder, put the terratonic 1.18.2 you just posted into resourcepacks folder, kept tectonic-large-biomes in resourcepacks, and edited java config and config loader portions to load the resourcepacks like in 1.19. i don't know why in 1.18 it adds it to "available" vs in 1.19 it adds to "loaded" (e.g. left vs right columns), but that's what happened (same with my tectonic-bop compat).

naomi
Sat Apr 22 17:01:45 +0000 2023

resourcepacks

Sat Apr 22 17:02:53 +0000 2023

Would it be possible to world blend an existing vanilla world into using tectonic + terralith

sarah the rat
Wed May 10 17:04:46 +0000 2023

Has anyone else had issues like this with tectonic, arboria and pregen? It's definitely a chunk error, and doesn't occur on the same coordinates on the same seed when I don't pregen. I'm using chunky. It's not too big of a deal just annoying lol

Summerdrive
Wed May 10 21:36:05 +0000 2023

I have not tested this, but in theory it should be possible, but it would take a bit of work. First I'll say that I've had lots and lots of experience blending worlds and parts of worlds using MCASelector, and I've also struggled with blending worlds that have worldgen mods and datapacks, but I now think I know why. I've also successfully blended terralith worlds with standard blending techniques, but i believe this is because terralith apparently uses vanilla worldgen and just adds new biomes. So I believe (but haven't tested it yet) that if we were to temporarily rename the biomes in a tectonic or a terratonic + terralith world to standard minecraft biome names, then perhaps blending would work. You would then have to travel over the edges to make the blending happen and then rename the biomes back to the original modded names. So you can see it could be quite a bit of work, but in some cases it could be worth the trouble.

Apollo
Wed May 10 21:37:10 +0000 2023

technically yes but I strongly recommend not doing it as the blending artifacts will be WAY more noticable with tectonic then terralith

Summerdrive
Wed May 10 21:40:59 +0000 2023

I agree that it may both not work well, and like I said it would be a lot of work. This is something I've been meaning to test just to see if I could get it to work, but I haven't had the motivation to sit down for a couple hours and really figure it out.

Specimen
Wed May 10 21:41:00 +0000 2023

Apollo
Thu Jun 1 06:19:36 +0000 2023

nope

Apollo
Thu Jun 1 06:19:51 +0000 2023

datapack worldgen is experimental, therefore Realms does not support it

LeMieux
Thu Jun 1 06:24:17 +0000 2023

ah i see, thx

LeMieux
Thu Jun 1 06:28:53 +0000 2023

also im not really familiar with how minecraft updates are rolled out, but is it usually that experimental features like that are part of updates in general or are they pushed out as their own thing independent from large updates?

Apollo
Thu Jun 1 06:29:28 +0000 2023

datapack worldgen isnt a part of any particular update

Apollo
Thu Jun 1 06:29:39 +0000 2023

its experimental in the sense that they will just make breaking changes a lot

Apollo
Thu Jun 1 06:30:12 +0000 2023

1.17 broke most 1.16 worldgen packs, 1.18 broke every single 1.17 worldgen pack, 1.19 broke a lot of 1.18 worldgen packs, etc.

Thu Jun 1 06:30:22 +0000 2023

oh i see

Fri Jun 2 11:07:46 +0000 2023

Aye mates sorry to ask this silly question but I assume Terratonic V2 is only for Forge right? I have a server with 1.19.2 and I can't see support for neither. I am really not sure about the nature of data packs but I saw a forge folder in the zip so I assume it's only for forge?

a cats
Fri Jun 2 11:28:08 +0000 2023

Datapacks should work regardless of mod loader I may be wrong but if I remember correctly the forge folder for datapacks is just for biome tags to make them work nicer with mods that use them

naomi
Fri Jun 2 11:35:22 +0000 2023

Yep, that's correct

naomi
Fri Jun 2 11:35:46 +0000 2023

In fact, the `c` folder is what is used by fabric

naomi
Fri Jun 2 11:36:43 +0000 2023

But yeah, datapacks are vanilla features - so unless they use something explicitly added by a *mod* - they will *generally* work on any loader

Captain Democracy "The Napalm"
Fri Jun 2 11:54:16 +0000 2023

Apollo
Sun Jun 4 02:22:18 +0000 2023

pretty much most mods that add biomes use it to place biomes in vanilla dimensions

Ian
Sun Jun 4 02:24:35 +0000 2023

Apollo
Sun Jun 4 02:26:34 +0000 2023

tectonic does not need terrablender

Apollo
Sun Jun 4 02:26:51 +0000 2023

wwoo is special in that there's two "modes" for the mod; one requires terrablender and the other does not

Ian
Sun Jun 4 02:28:15 +0000 2023

Sun Jun 4 02:28:40 +0000 2023

no

Sun Jun 4 02:30:26 +0000 2023

one uses terrablender and is compatible with tectonic/terralith

Apollo
Sun Jun 4 02:30:31 +0000 2023

one doesnt and is not compatible with them

Sun Jun 4 02:33:20 +0000 2023

Sun Jun 4 02:34:06 +0000 2023

terrablender would be needed yes

and that will apply for v2 as well

Fri Jun 16 10:38:55 +0000 2023

Fri Jun 16 10:40:21 +0000 2023

Sun Jun 18 20:24:12 +0000 2023

Don't want to ping you Apollo, but I just read your patch notes for 1.20 and was curious about what led to your decision to make slightly less flat areas. No hate, just actually curious about this change.

Apollo
Sun Jun 25 02:03:21 +0000 2023

I got feedback from several different people about how the terrain being very flat was very boring, and so I added more places with hillier terrain

Apollo
Sun Jun 25 02:03:42 +0000 2023

I did leave in large expanses of flat terrain, they're just more spread out and don't dominate the entire map

catter

Does the biome map viewer work properly with terralith + tectonic?

Apollo
Mon Jul 3 06:10:58 +0000 2023

felixsu7
Mon Jul 3 09:45:55 +0000 2023

I'm probably dumb but how do you manage the loading order on severs? (specifically paper), or could i just put terralith and terratonic (terratonic has tectonic as it has been said) inside the datapacks folder and it would work?

Cadentem
Mon Jul 3 10:02:49 +0000 2023

datapacks are sorted by their name terratonic will be loaded after terralith due to that you can modify the sort by changing the name of the .zip / directories (adding a `z` at the start e.g.)

𝙤𝙠𝙯𝙚𝙧𝙪𝙨
Mon Jul 3 10:03:56 +0000 2023

01-terratonic 02-terralith

felixsu7
Mon Jul 3 10:04:25 +0000 2023

ooooooooo thanks

Mon Jul 3 10:13:42 +0000 2023

Apollo
Mon Jul 3 10:14:09 +0000 2023

albeit the generation won't be *quite* like it is normally; the continents on average will be absolutely massive

Sat Jul 22 16:42:43 +0000 2023

Go to the root folder of the datapack and run `grep painted -R .`. You'll probably need to install grep with winget though.

Matthew
Sat Jul 22 16:43:11 +0000 2023

That will recursively search the entire datapack for lines containing 'painted'.

Saturn
Sun Jul 23 00:57:03 +0000 2023

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 00:57:13 +0000 2023

Then you could do `cd .minecraft`

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 00:57:17 +0000 2023

Etc

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:00:15 +0000 2023

The syntax for grep (for how most people use it) is basically `grep "search expression" ` to search a single file or `grep "search expression" -R ` to search an entire directory structure. You could also do `*.txt` as the to search every .txt file in your current directory.

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:00:41 +0000 2023

It's case sensitive, but if you add `-i` it will become case insensitive.

Saturn
Sun Jul 23 01:00:50 +0000 2023

How come it doesnt recognize grep?

Saturn
Sun Jul 23 01:01:03 +0000 2023

I am doing grep painted_mountains .minecraft

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:01:42 +0000 2023

You may have to restart your PC. Winget installs each app to its own folder and then updates the PATH variable on your system. The PATH variable is how powershell (or cmd) knows where to look for programs it can run.

Saturn
Sun Jul 23 01:01:50 +0000 2023

o ok

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:01:54 +0000 2023

But the change doesn't take effect immediately.

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:02:04 +0000 2023

Yeah it's kinda annoying, but it is what it is I guess.

Saturn
Sun Jul 23 01:02:09 +0000 2023

oof

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:02:28 +0000 2023

Maybe they'll improve that in the coming months.

Saturn
Sun Jul 23 01:02:38 +0000 2023

all of this is worth it to scour every file with the word paintedmountains

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:03:03 +0000 2023

Well it's also just a useful tool imo, that you may end up using more in the future for other things.

Saturn
Sun Jul 23 01:03:11 +0000 2023

yeah

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:03:23 +0000 2023

But if not, `winget uninstall grep` it's just as easy to remove it 😂

naomi
Sun Jul 23 01:05:15 +0000 2023

if using powershell you can just do `refreshenv`

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:05:42 +0000 2023

It can do regular expressions too. Which is not something I'm gonna explain here, but it's a more advanced way to search. Say I wanted to search for phone numbers in the format `xxx-xxx-xxxx`. I could do `grep -E "\d{3}-\d{3}-\d{4}" ...` where `\d` represents a number (0-9).

Matthew
Sun Jul 23 01:05:58 +0000 2023

Oh nice - yeah that's more convenient than reboot haha.

naomi
Sun Jul 23 01:06:06 +0000 2023

naomi
Sun Jul 23 01:06:13 +0000 2023

you never need to restart PC in most cases

Sun Jul 23 01:06:14 +0000 2023

The Dwindling Light
Fri Jul 28 16:21:41 +0000 2023

Deep darks(ancient cities by extension) always spawn beneath tall terrain, such as mountains and meadows, but any biome can be tall so it looks like you're in a really tall landmass Hence the cities

RedCowboy

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 01:42:27 +0000 2023

nope

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 09:13:24 +0000 2023

I know someone is going to ask about it in the future so I'll just put it here now: ## Upgrading from Tectonic v1 to Tectonic v2 - Open Minecraft with Tectonic v2 installed, and then close it. - Open up your minecraft instance directory (normally `.minecraft`, open `config`, then open `tectonic.json`. - Set `legacy_mode` to `true`. - Open the world(s) you wish to upgrade. They will be automatically updated to Tectonic v2. - Open up the config file again and set `legacy_mode` back to `false` to prevent any issues down the line.

ChrisHere91
Mon Jul 31 10:37:37 +0000 2023

Mon Jul 31 10:41:41 +0000 2023

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 22:15:20 +0000 2023

ok

murao.kun
Mon Jul 31 22:15:21 +0000 2023

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 22:15:44 +0000 2023

`data/minecraft/worldgen/density_function/overworld/offset.json`

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 22:15:46 +0000 2023

it will look like this

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 22:15:52 +0000 2023

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 22:16:17 +0000 2023

lines 51 to 70 are what you need to modify

Apollo
Mon Jul 31 22:16:50 +0000 2023

change both instances of -0.45 to -0.22, and -0.15 with -0.12

Adm. Milkyway
Sun Aug 20 15:12:29 +0000 2023

I have installed terratonic on my server(1.20) and i wanted to ask if those overhanging cliffs are intended. They look cool but they generate a little to often. is there a possibility to modify the datapacks to stop them from generating?

Summerdrive
Sun Aug 20 15:18:26 +0000 2023

Yea, the tree problem is a known problem with blending, but the terrain is the thing that is the most important and it's good to know that it worked. Did you first just upgrade the world without the forceblend and then have problems and then went to the MCASelector forceblend?

Axd1x8a
Sun Aug 20 15:21:52 +0000 2023

Yes, but I deleted all new regions and chunks with borders and after that marked chunks for blending

Axd1x8a
Sun Aug 20 15:21:59 +0000 2023

Like this

Summerdrive
Sun Aug 20 15:30:05 +0000 2023

Just so I'm clear about exactly what you did (so that others can copy ypur process), I guess you mean that you could tell in MCAselector which chunks had bad edges and then deleted them (and nearby chunks too to leave room for blending) and then after that selected the border chunks of all the remaining old land masses and set the forceblend on those (like in your image).

Axd1x8a
Sun Aug 20 15:30:09 +0000 2023

here some examples of new terrain

Summerdrive
Sun Aug 20 15:33:34 +0000 2023

it looks like a new mountain in the right side image, but it's too dark for me to be sure

Axd1x8a
Sun Aug 20 15:34:37 +0000 2023

there is nother example

Axd1x8a
Sun Aug 20 15:36:02 +0000 2023

In my case, only some of the chunks were generated "successfully", some chunks had to be deleted right in the middle of regions and marked neighboring ones for blending

Axd1x8a
Sun Aug 20 15:36:57 +0000 2023

But it made transitions very smooth, like in the screenshots

Summerdrive
Sun Aug 20 15:38:35 +0000 2023

I guess the bad ones in the middle of regions was because the chunks were empty there before the upgrade and so the new generation (before you used forceblend) had the bad chunk edges. And the new terrain in the last images looks really nice.

murao.kun
Sat Aug 26 12:24:20 +0000 2023

Hello once again, Apollo. There another conflicting the mods thing I found in tectonic. In tectonic edges of the river (because of smoothness) are visually rivers, but technically they are different biome already. It is case to case, sometime they rarely match each other. But most of the time it is like that. This is nothing crazy for vanilla, but mods that having features generating on river edges, once again like Upgrade Aquatic and their river trees, are failing a lot, resulting in very rare tree spawns with tectonic installed. I wish to disable river smoothing, can you help me with that and point how to do so?

Freshah
Sat Aug 26 12:30:41 +0000 2023

Oh I bet those mods that add Silt and other underwater gen to rivers get borked too

murao.kun
Sat Aug 26 12:35:17 +0000 2023

Yeah! Any modded disks features that are added to the river biomes exclusively will spawn only on river centers instead of being possible to appear on edges. Vanilla disks are presented in every biomes, so that is not really noticable.

Apollo
Sat Aug 26 19:31:01 +0000 2023

this happens in vanilla as well

Apollo
Sat Aug 26 19:31:07 +0000 2023

there's not much i can do

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 00:20:14 +0000 2023

You mean something like this? (It was actually done with blending, which makes some incredible things possible)

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:22:06 +0000 2023

pretty much, though maybe a little less of a harsh contrast

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 00:23:47 +0000 2023

Yeah, I did just want to show an extreme example, just to point out what's possible

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:24:23 +0000 2023

though blending isn't part of the vanilla generation of a world

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 00:26:48 +0000 2023

Correct, I use it when I have an idea of a area I want to make exactly like I imagine. In the above area i was also able to put an ancient city under it. I sorta like to place several unique areas around a world, and blending is so much easier than something like worldpainter because no artistic talent is needed.

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:27:28 +0000 2023

well that's not helpful for a survival world sadly

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 00:27:59 +0000 2023

this is a survival world, you can add cool custom stuff if you want

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:28:26 +0000 2023

yeah but that's cheating, i'm talking about a normal survival world, which can't enjoy that sort of gen as-is

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 00:31:05 +0000 2023

interesting definition of cheating, but I guess you don't include worldgen mods/datapacks as cheating, but I understand if that's how you look at it. I was playing Jeracrafts server which is Terralith with lots of custom stuff all around the world, and most people like what he added.

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:32:36 +0000 2023

there's a difference between modded minecraft and running commands controlling your world

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 00:33:10 +0000 2023

You just game me an amazing idea, a mod that uses blending to create amazing stuff with just vanilla biomes blended by the mod in unusual but interesting ways.

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:33:15 +0000 2023

you can't play mods without mods lol, so you definitely are going out on a limb to find it weird i don't consider that cheating - it's not vanilla, it's meant to be modded

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:33:25 +0000 2023

that's actually a great idea!

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 00:33:47 +0000 2023

the amount of stuff you could do with a blending-gen mod

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 00:52:54 +0000 2023

Yeah, I could even imagine being able to specify what kinds of mixtures of biomes you would like blending to happen with and maybe how often. In my first thoughts I could imagine that it would be easiest to make a new type of mod that pregenerates a whole world. In my experience being able to generate smaller patches of terrain around the world on a first pass, and then on a 2nd (or even 3rd, 4th etc pass) you use a different world gen "formula" that then blends with the first (and maybe 2nd and 3rd etc) patches that were just made. And since Minecraft now does 3D blending, this could make an incredible world.

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 01:55:38 +0000 2023

yeah, it could be a pre-gen woldgen mod hybrid, would love to see how it goes

Rebel459
Sun Sep 3 01:56:00 +0000 2023

and integration with stuff like tectonic would work very well

living failure
Sun Sep 3 09:06:44 +0000 2023

living failure
Sun Sep 3 09:07:04 +0000 2023

living failure
Sun Sep 3 09:10:59 +0000 2023

an underground river entrance would be even better

Summerdrive
Sun Sep 3 11:20:56 +0000 2023

Unfortunately I don't have the time or the java skills to make such a mod, although the main components can be pulled from other open source projects. I've worked with blending enough to know exactly what it would have to do, so maybe some mod developer would be interested in taking on the project. I suspect that it could be revolutionary.

Apollo
Thu Sep 21 07:53:11 +0000 2023

I altered the density function `minecraft:overworld/sloped_cheese` from this: ```json { "type": "minecraft:add", "argument1": { "type": "minecraft:mul", "argument1": 4, "argument2": { "type": "minecraft:quarter_negative", "argument": { "type": "minecraft:mul", "argument1": { "type": "minecraft:add", "argument1": "minecraft:overworld/depth", "argument2": { "type": "minecraft:mul", "argument1": "minecraft:overworld/jaggedness", "argument2": { "type": "minecraft:half_negative", "argument": { "type": "minecraft:noise", "noise": "minecraft:jagged", "xz_scale": 1500, "y_scale": 0 } } } }, "argument2": "minecraft:overworld/factor" } } }, "argument2": "minecraft:overworld/base_3d_noise" } ``` to this: ```json { "type": "minecraft:add", "argument1": "minecraft:overworld/depth", "argument2": { "type": "minecraft:mul", "argument1": "minecraft:overworld/jaggedness", "argument2": { "type": "minecraft:half_negative", "argument": { "type": "minecraft:noise", "noise": "minecraft:jagged", "xz_scale": 1500, "y_scale": 0 } } } } ```

Apollo
Fri Sep 29 03:55:19 +0000 2023

when you are on the datapack screen in-game, Terratonic is supposed to be above Terralith

Apollo
Fri Sep 29 03:55:40 +0000 2023

on a server, all datapacks are just loaded in alphabetical order

Ήertz
Fri Sep 29 12:29:52 +0000 2023

On client it loads before terralith and in a server it needs to load after terralith? Am I gettting it wrong?

Ήertz
Fri Sep 29 12:31:39 +0000 2023

I don't know how the datapack screen in-game works cause I've only used datapack in servers

Ήertz
Fri Sep 29 12:31:46 +0000 2023

I'm just curious

naomi
Fri Sep 29 12:32:47 +0000 2023

It needs to load before terralith on both client and server - the reason terratonic has to come after terralith alphabetically is because the game adds datapacks alphabetically, so it adds ADatapack before BDatapack meaning BDatapack will be "above" ADatapack and thus BDatapack will load before ADatapack

naomi
Fri Sep 29 12:32:50 +0000 2023

if that makes sense

Ήertz
Fri Sep 29 12:34:59 +0000 2023

I get it

Ήertz
Fri Sep 29 12:36:13 +0000 2023

When you say "above" in the client do you mean like vertically above terralith? I guess you mean having terralith first from top to bottom

Ήertz
Fri Sep 29 12:36:36 +0000 2023

Why is it so confusing to me lol

Rebel459
Fri Sep 29 12:37:00 +0000 2023

~~I believe the game does them in reverse alphabetical order…~~

naomi
Fri Sep 29 12:37:06 +0000 2023

Terratonic is first, top to bottom

Fri Sep 29 12:37:30 +0000 2023

Nvm, it’s like resource packs iirc

Thu Oct 19 00:32:04 +0000 2023

Apollo
Thu Oct 19 00:32:29 +0000 2023

the foundation of Tectonic's terrain is the mountain generation

Apollo
Thu Oct 19 00:32:31 +0000 2023

you'd have to rip out river generation from Tectonic and force it into vanilla generation

Aulderis
Mon Oct 23 09:15:40 +0000 2023

Oh why ? By 100% i mostly mean playable in multi without making new world each update

Apollo
Mon Oct 23 09:16:51 +0000 2023

Safe upgrading between Tectonic versions is something I have strived for, but its not a 100% guarantee; Mojang could always come in with a massive overhaul to worldgen and break all existing packs. While that's probably years and years down the line, it's not impossible

Tue Oct 24 19:08:58 +0000 2023

Tue Oct 24 19:10:02 +0000 2023

i think all maps "generate" chunks separately from what are actually generated

catter
Mon Nov 6 17:22:43 GMT 2023

Mon Nov 6 17:22:55 GMT 2023

Summerdrive
Tue Nov 7 00:29:55 GMT 2023

When you say there are chunks that don't generate, I'm curious what you are using to view the worlds. I prefer UnMined which is a great viewer. And you asked about doing the pregeneration without all the other mods. If you think none of the other mods are changing world generation then it might be good to test the pregeneration without them and see if the results are different. AND, if any of the other mods DO affect world generation then that could be causing problems too - so again it would be good to test a pregneration with no other mods other than Tectonic.

Dartheus Pater
Tue Nov 7 06:03:52 GMT 2023

Tue Nov 7 09:42:34 GMT 2023

And if you don't use stuff to see your worldmap, no offense but why do you even talk about them if you don't know how they work? And when you say 'iirc, Journeymap "generates" chunks in their own way' you leave the impression that you use something else different for it, that actually works, but you don't even use mods 😄 anyway i appreciate the help

Summerdrive
Tue Nov 7 11:47:11 GMT 2023

I have used Chunky many times, and I have never had missing chunks. I've used it many times with Tectonic also, but I would only have that one datapack and no mods when I did the pregeneration. That's why I suggested testing it without any other mods during the pregeneration.

Markie
Tue Nov 7 11:59:46 GMT 2023

Markie
Tue Nov 7 12:01:44 GMT 2023

Yeah it's good to know that JourneyMap might cause the issue with not being able to see all chunks on the map pregenerated by Chunky

Summerdrive
Tue Nov 7 12:32:39 GMT 2023

Also, if UnMined showed any missing chunks after pregeneration, you could run Chunky again on the same world and it would probably fill in those missing chunks. I've seen the Chunky developer recommending that and he said that Chunky runs very fast with worlds that are mostly generated because it just skips over existing fully generated chunks.

Markie
Tue Nov 7 12:46:24 GMT 2023

On JourneyMap, there's a feature called auto-mapping, once you press it, it starts to show what Chunky pregenerated. But idk about UnMined, all i have to do is Run chunky and after, just open UnMined with the specific world and done?

Summerdrive
Tue Nov 7 12:56:50 GMT 2023

Right, UnMined is a world viewer that let's you zoom out to see the whole world or zoom in to see individual blocks and everything in between. It also let's you go underground and find things like caves and ores and spawners or special blocks if you need to. It also will export a web map if you want, with coordinates as you travel around, and you can add markers for where players are if you want.

Markie
Tue Nov 7 13:24:26 GMT 2023

Web map? where is that ?

Summerdrive
Tue Nov 7 13:31:01 GMT 2023

It's best to look at their discord for details, there are lots of things it can do.

Tectonic, WWEE > * In this case we don't have so much mini-biomes and WWEE is now covering max 10% of world generation cuz it's still trying to generate basic biomes which Tectonic is using to generate it's own surfaces. > * It's less broken when generating oceans and rivers.

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:39:34 GMT 2023

its for rivers

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:39:46 GMT 2023

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 20:39:50 GMT 2023

in vanilla its rivers + mountain peaks but tectonic changes that

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:40:15 GMT 2023

there unfortunately isn't much documentation on how the vanilla world gen works at the deep file level

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:40:30 GMT 2023

minecraft.wiki is still lacking in that regard

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:40:42 GMT 2023

tectonic mountain generation works like this: - get erosion noise value - close to 0 (+- 0.2)? generate higher up terrain the closer you get to 0 - not close to 0? generate normal terrain

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:41:07 GMT 2023

it is extremely simple, the mountain shaping itself is like two spline points <:kekw:744867847934836846>

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 20:41:21 GMT 2023

Asking in the minecraft configs / worldgen discords is usually your best bet for worldgen queries

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:41:30 GMT 2023

thinking about it it may be possible to pull off with high resolution 3d noise overlayed to a lower res heightmap generation like mine at the moment

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 20:41:30 GMT 2023

i can go find invites if you want

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:41:48 GMT 2023

please. Even though I am once again at 100 discord servers grr

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:42:12 GMT 2023

so the trick of generating lines happens in erosion?

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 20:42:20 GMT 2023

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:42:27 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:43:32 GMT 2023

mind explaining how that works? layered perlin noise by itself afaik doesn't really create lines

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:43:36 GMT 2023

the funny thing with noise is that it creates lines at/near values of 0

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:43:38 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:43:55 GMT 2023

at least perlin noise

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:44:14 GMT 2023

if I read this right, minecraft has no other generator types other than 3d perlin noise, right?

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:44:39 GMT 2023

you can define xz and y scales

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:44:49 GMT 2023

so you have access to 2d noise (1d is possible with a special trick but it's never used anywhere)

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:44:55 GMT 2023

I am aware

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:44:58 GMT 2023

but still just perlin

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:45:01 GMT 2023

yes

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 20:45:09 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:45:52 GMT 2023

true. but some of the fancier mountain generation approaches seem to be going towards fractal and other noise things I do not understand yet.

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:45:54 GMT 2023

shifted noise is how Terralith makes this

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:46:22 GMT 2023

though the shifting itself is also a pretty hard coded function in datapacks it seems

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:46:35 GMT 2023

what?

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:47:58 GMT 2023

the shift_a and shift_b functions both appear to be hard coded to sample a certain shift with no control over how strong that shift is

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:48:24 GMT 2023

thats not what shifted noise is

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:48:45 GMT 2023

the shifted_noise allows shifting one noise by another noise, one of which could be a constant I guess

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:49:07 GMT 2023

the `shifted_noise` df lets you shift on any axis by another density function

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:49:16 GMT 2023

it doesn't have to be noise or a constant

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:49:47 GMT 2023

I see. I'm not used to discerning between density functions and noise yet

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:50:17 GMT 2023

made some space in my servers and joined them. thank you!

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:51:14 GMT 2023

density functions are how the game wires noise, constants and other things together to make worldgen

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:52:00 GMT 2023

`continentalness` is a noise, but on its own it doesnt do anything. it goes through a spline function in order to get an offset value from it which can actually be used to determine terrain height

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:53:46 GMT 2023

I'm used to all that layering happening directly in the texture phase from game dev

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:54:33 GMT 2023

here the power really lies in having simple noises and preprocessing them in 3d before they become a world as there are blocks being placed instead of a heightmap mesh

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:56:08 GMT 2023

I still haven't gotten behind how flat_cache works and how that field then becomes blocks

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 20:58:53 GMT 2023

as I can see it you generate an effectively 2d map in the erosion density function, push that to the erosion noise router and the final density noise router then uses the interpolated argument to somehow make that into a heightmap of blocks

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 20:58:54 GMT 2023

flat cache just forces the game to use whatever value is at y0 in the current x/z position

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:01:09 GMT 2023

I am struggling to follow how that in the end becomes a height map for the final_density noise router

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:02:06 GMT 2023

on its own noise wont create a heightmap

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:02:30 GMT 2023

this is how the game creates the base heightmap for the overworld ```json { "type": "minecraft:add", "argument1": { "type": "minecraft:y_clamped_gradient", "from_y": -64, "to_y": 320, "from_value": 1.5, "to_value": -1.5 }, "argument2": "minecraft:overworld/offset" } ```

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:02:59 GMT 2023

if `offset` is 0, the game will place blocks at y128 and block with air otherwise being placed

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:03:17 GMT 2023

the higher the `offset`, the higher up the terrain will generate before it just places air

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:03:36 GMT 2023

ahhh, I see. by overlaying the 2d map with the gradient you effectively make it a linear 3d height map

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:03:44 GMT 2023

neat

naomi
Wed Dec 13 21:04:27 GMT 2023

words

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:04:34 GMT 2023

phew, I intended to launch S2 of my create mod server friday next week. If I want to dive this deep into custom world gen that will be... rough

Wed Dec 13 21:05:30 GMT 2023

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:08:27 GMT 2023

not viable

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:09:08 GMT 2023

regular rivers work because their water level is the same as the sea level

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:09:21 GMT 2023

you cant conditionally force the sea level upwards for rivers

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:10:04 GMT 2023

~~unless~~

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:10:05 GMT 2023

you cant hack aquifers to make it work because aquifers have barriers between them and only can change elevation in multiples of 3 every ~64 blocks

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:10:34 GMT 2023

I get the feeling mojang themselves pulled quite some nasty stuff

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:10:38 GMT 2023

the closest you can get is with surface rules and they are trash

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:11:03 GMT 2023

if only we could reference density functions in surface rules

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:11:05 GMT 2023

the worldgen system works well for what they need it to do, it's just that we're trying to do things that were never intended <:kekw:744867847934836846>

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:11:26 GMT 2023

that wouldnt really help with this tbh

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:11:55 GMT 2023

you'd still have messed up water generation like this due to how water in this game functions

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:13:19 GMT 2023

placing flowing water would have to be handled by the generation itself too, it wouldn't flow right when placed ontop of other water sources

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:14:16 GMT 2023

that would mean having to reimplement how water is handled

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:14:45 GMT 2023

I think it is technically possible to place blocks like flowing water of a specific height

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:14:51 GMT 2023

Oh I didn't think about that issue

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:14:57 GMT 2023

and even if after all of that it *somehow* works, traveling along them is still unviable two-ways because boats can't go up water like in bedrock :)

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:15:10 GMT 2023

they can go up sloped water

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:15:23 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:15:23 GMT 2023

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:15:39 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:15:58 GMT 2023

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:16:00 GMT 2023

that is something that simply isnt possible with vanilla terrain generation

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:16:28 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:16:48 GMT 2023

thought I'm more guessing with how limited my knowledge of the block placement side is

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:17:08 GMT 2023

when a position is having its density sampled, it has no knowledge of the density surrounding it

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:17:48 GMT 2023

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:17:54 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:18:05 GMT 2023

true, especially the lag

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 21:18:46 GMT 2023

Wed Dec 13 21:30:53 GMT 2023

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:31:32 GMT 2023

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:32:33 GMT 2023

It's only really this bit that's important

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:33:40 GMT 2023

I have some noise function, find the gradient (in 2d) at the coordinate of the pixel

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:33:59 GMT 2023

then I add `that * some constant` to the position

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:34:06 GMT 2023

and repeat many times

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:34:19 GMT 2023

interesting. so kind of a flow field

Rennen_Rig
Wed Dec 13 21:34:24 GMT 2023

Exactly!

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 21:34:42 GMT 2023

raises a question too: can splines be modified based on other world gen parameters, or are they permanently hardcoded?

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 22:57:02 GMT 2023

splines simply take a density function as an input value and map it to an output value

HB Stratos
Wed Dec 13 22:57:30 GMT 2023

with this every mesa terrace would be the same height everywhere, unless splines can somehow be influenced by other parameters, which would be really powerful

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 22:58:22 GMT 2023

you could take this output value and multiply it by a noise to get some variation

Apollo
Wed Dec 13 23:55:51 GMT 2023

catter
Wed Dec 13 23:59:26 GMT 2023

the reason Stardust Labs has a strict license actually has nothing to do with money whatsoever

catter
Wed Dec 13 23:59:43 GMT 2023

i will indirectly quote Star as best as I can from memory

catter
Thu Dec 14 00:01:27 GMT 2023

"Terralith is my art form. I want there to be only one version of Terralith spread around. Multiple versions of it will cause confusion and taint the original form. Also, I don't want people asking for support when they inevitibly screw something up when modifying it - or worse, receiving a modified copy and not knowing its modified"

catter
Thu Dec 14 00:01:45 GMT 2023

again, very indirect quote, and im paraphrasing a lot and doing my best off of memory. there are also other reasons, but that's the gist

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 00:02:42 GMT 2023

the second part of people screwing up modifications is unfortunately far too common in stardustcord :/

Rebel459
Thu Dec 14 00:03:56 GMT 2023

Yep, doesn’t matter what you do I think at some point i was the clueless one screwing things up

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:03:27 GMT 2023

is it somehow possible to shift a density function instead of the underlying noise?

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:04:05 GMT 2023

no

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:04:34 GMT 2023

darn. hmmm, that is annoying

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:05:08 GMT 2023

A lot of neat tricks I wanted to copy from the parametric design world don't work if I can't do that. Needs a lot of redundant code

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:05:12 GMT 2023

when I said this system isn't built for what you want to do, I wasn't kidding <:kekw:744867847934836846>

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:05:46 GMT 2023

this system is a bit too taylored for minecraft 1.18+'s very specific terrain generation

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:09:46 GMT 2023

not really, this system has quite a lot of functionality its just built with the intention that terrain shaping is done without knowledge of whats around it

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:09:58 GMT 2023

which makes sense considering it's infinite terrain we're working with lol

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:10:27 GMT 2023

yeah. there are a few methods for mildly realistic terrain under these circumstances out there. but almost all require a surface derivative

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:12:07 GMT 2023

I can't imagine that being easy with infinite terrain considering you'd need to be continuously sampling terrain around the position being generated so that the slope is accurate

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:12:56 GMT 2023

Nullscape uses it extremely well for example

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:13:05 GMT 2023

there is no accurate method that creates perfect results from only noise. but some that are definitely better than just layered perlin

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:13:47 GMT 2023

as I said, this system isnt built with the idea that terrain shaping is aware of the terrain around it

Apollo
Thu Dec 14 10:14:13 GMT 2023

this is just how density functions work, if you want to work with density functions this is what you're putting up with ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:14:59 GMT 2023

fair. I wanna try it at least.

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:18:42 GMT 2023

what I don't fully understand yet is how it's possible for eldor to modify general terrain shape, and then for terralith to generate it's massive ice spikes on top of that. As far as I understand it one would override the other instead of adding together

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:25:33 GMT 2023

woah lol

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 10:36:40 GMT 2023

if I want to purely generate a height map, where should I use the Cache2d argument? Top level of the last density function, or pretty much everywhere I sample a noise?

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 11:08:34 GMT 2023

noise texture

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 11:09:06 GMT 2023

and corresponding slope. This works, though I doubt my implementation is efficient

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 12:41:13 GMT 2023

okay, so here I've layered the base noise with itself in a shifted form such that the steeper the slope, the more noise gets compressed into 'channels' running down the mountainside. It's only one octave, but I think it looks quite okay already

HB Stratos
Thu Dec 14 14:44:17 GMT 2023

Solid
Fri Dec 15 14:27:10 GMT 2023

yo how can i make strucutres generate deeper in ocean biomes

Solid
Fri Dec 15 14:27:26 GMT 2023

loads of yung's better mineshafts generate in the water

Rebel459
Fri Dec 15 21:18:40 GMT 2023

You’d need to remove the ocean biome from their respective tag, then make a duplicate structure file for each structure but with a new tag only containing the ocean, and set the structure in that file to generate at a lower range

1.20.2+ buffed diamond gen though

Sun Dec 17 09:59:33 GMT 2023

*but if it’s an issue for you, you could add a mod to rebalance ore drops (eg diamond nuggets)*

Rebel459
Sun Dec 17 09:59:54 GMT 2023

…or just manually wipe the diamond ore buff via a datapack

catter

catter
Tue Dec 19 23:28:26 GMT 2023

just keep in mind that the *second* you add a mod that required Terrablender, like BoP, the compatibility between mods like Terralith get destroyed. plus, Tectonic's compat for Terralith is *specifically* coded - it isn't such for BoP

Apollo
Tue Dec 19 23:28:27 GMT 2023

If you throw in several large biomes mods they all start to become slop in my experience

Apollo
Tue Dec 19 23:29:19 GMT 2023

I'm obligated to say Terralith + Tectonic is good, but I've tried others as well and gotten solid results (Regions Unexplored + Tectonic was fun)

Tue Dec 19 23:30:22 GMT 2023

oh, yes - RU is a great quality mod as well

catter
Tue Dec 19 23:30:42 GMT 2023

Tue Dec 19 23:32:10 GMT 2023

catter
Fri Dec 29 15:04:42 GMT 2023

Tectonic is a datapack, which is notably **not** a mod. datapacks dont have any code to them - just JSON (and built-in minecraft commands, but those arent used for worldgeneration). because they cant have code, they cannot have a config file

catter
Fri Dec 29 15:05:46 GMT 2023

well, the mod "version" of Tectonic is practically just the datapack ||technically it has more stuff, but thats not the purpose of this explanation||, but renamed to `.jar` so it will load as a mod. so even though it loads as a mod - which are coded in Java - it isnt *actually* a full mod

catter
Fri Dec 29 15:06:20 GMT 2023

that's what naomi was talking about. if the <#1009333637340201032> ever ends up happening, its possible that Tectonic could because a "real" mod. that means it *could* get its own config and all that jazz

CinnabarBread
Fri Dec 29 15:27:54 GMT 2023

Ohhhhhh okay that makes a lot of sense

CinnabarBread
Fri Dec 29 15:29:18 GMT 2023

Thanks for the explanation :)

naomi
Fri Dec 29 16:04:47 GMT 2023

Yeah remember java IS NOT Java Script

naomi
Fri Dec 29 16:05:03 GMT 2023

One is shit, and the other is a language from hell itself

Mon Jan 8 10:45:43 GMT 2024

Will you continue working on Tectonic now that Apollo is stepping back from the project?

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 12:17:45 GMT 2024

I'm not sure. I've only worked on mountains so far and don't even fully understand most of the rest of it, let alone the terralith compatibility. my time will also be limited. So I think at most I can be a very slow maintainer, almost anyone else could probably do a better job than me.

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 12:23:48 GMT 2024

I started working on modifying tectonic and learning about DFs and worldgen in general last month when working on custom world generation for the create mod server I run. I have now modified tectonic to the point of it being usable for S2 of the server which will launch soon. I have plans for S3 to write my own world generation project based on continents of finite size, which will allow me to employ much more advanced terrain generation methods that don't work on infinite terrain. That project will hopefully be good enough to match or surpass tectonic, and that will most likely be a project I will maintain for some time.

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 12:25:14 GMT 2024

TL;DR: I have lots of other projects and already struggle enough with motivation. I could probably help save tectonic as a very slow maintainer, but if anyone else could take that job and I could just submit pull requests when I got the time, that would be a whole lot better.

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 12:28:00 GMT 2024

Apollo, if you're still here and reading this, it would be hugely appreciated if you could type out explanations on how tectonic works and what future ideas you had for it. I would archive this and keep it safe for any future maintainer. Or even better, you could put it on the github so any future maintainer will immediately find it.

If that makes any sense lol

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 13:40:07 GMT 2024

true. With what I'm planning for a custom world generator that stays vanilla friendly something like this should be possible

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 13:42:59 GMT 2024

as I will be working with discrete continents I can implement things like a simple tectonic plate and erosion simulation, leading to big mountain ridges and rain shadow deserts. At least that's the plan, it'll be a whole lot of coding

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 13:43:46 GMT 2024

which will also mean it will have to be a mod, there is no way I'm doing this as a datapack. However, the mod will output a datapack density function and load it, which should preserve compatibility with datapacks like terralith

Rebel459
Mon Jan 8 13:47:33 GMT 2024

That would be awesome. 2 questions: would it work with existing worlds and what are discrete continents?

Rebel459
Mon Jan 8 13:48:23 GMT 2024

Also unrelated question: where would one find information on datapack/worldgen changes in order to port a worldgen-related datapack from 1.19 to 1.20?

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 13:49:52 GMT 2024

it would most likely not work with existing worlds, just like tectonic wouldn't work on an existing world (I think)

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 13:50:22 GMT 2024

minecraft.wiki -> datapacks -> changes section

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 13:54:09 GMT 2024

discrete continent means I'm not using perlin noise, which creates spagetti terrain in which with enough luck a continent can technically have infinite size. This means you can't do any pre-processing over an entire continent at once, because the concept of a continent having finite size is not a thing. In my idea, I generate discrete continents that can not touch each other, are forcibly separated by ocean. That way I can then take the continent and do operations on the entire continent at once, instead of one chunk at a time like in vanilla. This allows me to employ global methods for terrain simulation that need to have more context than what the current block is, but also how the entire rest of the continent looks like.

Rebel459
Mon Jan 8 14:01:56 GMT 2024

I very much look forward to your potential worldgen mod

HB Stratos
Mon Jan 8 14:08:22 GMT 2024

It will be an interesting endeavor. Lots of work for sure. I hope I can make it work some day. Keep your eyes peeled over on stardust since this place will die. I'll probably post there and on the terra discord whenever I get to working on it

Quidvio
Mon Jan 8 19:51:51 GMT 2024
